snippet: The federal appeals court has an unusual national mandate and should have 11 active judges.
abstract: Editorial urges Senate to confirm Pres Obama's three nominations for unfilled seats on the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, move that would bring court to full complement of 11 active judges; decries attempt by Sen Charles E Grassley to eliminate seats as part of misleadingly-labeled Court Efficiency Act.
lead_paragraph: The federal appeals court has an unusual national mandate and should have 11 active judges.

headline.seo: What Makes the D.C. Circuit Different?
headline.main: What Makes the D.C. Circuit Different?
headline.print_headline: What Makes the D.C. Circuit Different?
